options.content:
# SGXPlugin metrics

This section contains metrics pertaining to the SGX Plugin.

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "state".

Status field description: The state of the SGXPlugin.

The value HEALTHY indicates the SGXPlugin is running without any detected issues.

The value PENDING indicates the SGXPlugin is not yet healthy but no problems have been detected, and it is expected to become healthy without human intervention.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates a problem has been detected.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1. The value -1 indicates the status field value "UNHEALTHY". The value 0 indicates the status field value "PENDING". The value 1 indicates the status field value "HEALTHY".
panels.title: SGXPlugin state

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "state".

Status field description: The state of the SGXPlugin.

The value HEALTHY indicates the SGXPlugin is running without any detected issues.

The value PENDING indicates the SGXPlugin is not yet healthy but no problems have been detected, and it is expected to become healthy without human intervention.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates a problem has been detected.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1. The value -1 indicates the status field value "UNHEALTHY". The value 0 indicates the status field value "PENDING". The value 1 indicates the status field value "HEALTHY".
panels.title: SGXPlugin state

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "usedSGXDevices".

Status field description: The total number of pods that has gotten access to an SGX device. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Used SGX devices

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "usedSGXDevicesPerNode".

Status field description: The number of pods that has gotten access to an SGX device on a node. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Used SGX devices per node

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "availableSGXDevices".

Status field description: The total number of SGX devices that are allocatable but not used. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Allocatable (but not used) SGX devices

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "availableSGXDevicesPerNode".

Status field description: The number of SGX devices that are allocatable but not used at a node. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Allocatable (but not used) SGX devices per node

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "capacitySGXDevices".

Status field description: The total number of SGX devices allocatable by pods. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: SGX devices capacity

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "capacitySGXDevicesPerNode".

Status field description: The total number of SGX devices that can be allocated by pods on a node. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: SGX devices capacity per Node

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "healthyServingReplicas".

Status field description: The number of selected SGX-capable nodes with available SGX devices. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated. 

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of selected SGX-capable nodes with available SGX devices

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "sgxDeviceAlert".

Status field description: The number of selected SGX-capable nodes, which has no available devices in the particular device category. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of selected SGX-capable nodes with no available devices in the particular device category

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "desiredReplicas".

Status field description: The number of nodes on which the SGXPlugin has been selected to run. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.

names: {__name__="scone_sgxplugin_desired_replicas", container="manager", cr_name="sgxplugin", cr_namespace="scone-system", endpoint="http", instance="10.42.1.22:8080", job="scone-controller-manager-metrics-service", namespace="scone-system", pod="scone-controller-manager-7c6bdf5569-8rjlc", service="scone-controller-manager-metrics-service"}

panels.title: Number of nodes on which the SGXPlugin has been selected to run

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "readyReplicas".

Status field description: The number of nodes with a SGXPlugin pod in Ready state. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of nodes with a SGXPlugin pod in Ready state

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "servingReplicas".

Status field description: The number of SGX-capable nodes on which the SGXPlugin has been selected to run. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of SGX-capable nodes on which the SGXPlugin has been selected to run

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "servingReplicaRatio".

Status field description: The ratio of selected SGX-capable nodes with available SGX devices to the total of selected SGX-capable nodes (HealthyServingReplicas/ServingReplicas).

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.

Possible metric values: -1, float64 between 0 and 1. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.
panels.title: Ratio of selected SGX-capable nodes with available SGX devices

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "sgxReplicaAlert".

Status field description: The number of selected SGX-capable nodes with unavailable SGXPlugin pods. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of selected SGX-capable nodes with unavailable SGXPlugin pods

options.content:
# LAS metrics

This section contains metrics pertaining to the LAS.

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "state".

Status field description: The state of the LAS.


The value HEALTHY indicates the LAS is running without any detected issues.

The value PENDING indicates the LAS is not yet healthy but no problems have been detected, and it is expected to become healthy without human intervention.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates a problem has been detected.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1.  The value -1 indicates the status field value "UNHEALTHY". The value 0 indicates the status field value "PENDING". The value 1 indicates the status field value "HEALTHY".
panels.title: LAS state

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "state".

Status field description: The state of the LAS.


The value HEALTHY indicates the LAS is running without any detected issues.

The value PENDING indicates the LAS is not yet healthy but no problems have been detected, and it is expected to become healthy without human intervention.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates a problem has been detected.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1.  The value -1 indicates the status field value "UNHEALTHY". The value 0 indicates the status field value "PENDING". The value 1 indicates the status field value "HEALTHY".
panels.title: LAS state

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "desiredNumberScheduled".

Status field description: The number of nodes on which a LAS pod has been selected to run. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of nodes on which a LAS pod has been selected to run

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "numberAvailable".

Status field description: The number of nodes with a LAS pod in Ready state. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of nodes with a LAS pod in Ready state

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "lasReplicaAlert".

Status field description: The number of expected LAS pods that are not running. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated or that no pods were expected to run, which is also considered erroneous.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of expected LAS pods that are not running

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "lasProbeAlert".

Status field description: The number of desired replicas, where the LAS probe is failing.

The value -1 indicates that the probe could not be run (e.g., due to a pod not being ready) on at least one of the nodes.

The value 0 indicates that the LAS probe terminated successfully on all nodes. A value > 0 conveys the number of nodes on which the probe command failed, i.e., returned with a non-zero exit code.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of desired replicas where the LAS probe is failing

options.content:
# CAS metrics

This section contains metrics pertaining to the CAS.

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "attestable".

Status field description: The attestable state of the CAS, i.e., whether the SCONE operator could attest the CAS.

The value Yes indicates that the CAS was successfully attested.

The value No indicates that the CAS has not yet been provisioned.

The value Failed indicates that the attestation of the CAS failed.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1.  The value -1 indicates the status field value "Failed". The value 0 indicates the status field value "No". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Yes".
panels.title: CAS attestable

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "attestable".

Status field description: The attestable state of the CAS, i.e., whether the SCONE operator could attest the CAS.

The value Yes indicates that the CAS was successfully attested.

The value No indicates that the CAS has not yet been provisioned.

The value Failed indicates that the attestation of the CAS failed.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1.  The value -1 indicates the status field value "Failed". The value 0 indicates the status field value "No". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Yes".
panels.title: CAS attestable

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "state".

Status field description: The state of the CAS.

The value HEALTHY indicates the CAS is running without any detected issues.

The value PENDING indicates the CAS is not yet healthy but no problems have been detected, and it is expected to become healthy without human intervention.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates a problem has been detected.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1.  The value -1 indicates the status field value "UNHEALTHY". The value 0 indicates the status field value "PENDING". The value 1 indicates the status field value "HEALTHY".
panels.title: CAS state

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "state".

Status field description: The state of the CAS.

The value HEALTHY indicates the CAS is running without any detected issues.

The value PENDING indicates the CAS is not yet healthy but no problems have been detected, and it is expected to become healthy without human intervention.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates a problem has been detected.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1.  The value -1 indicates the status field value "UNHEALTHY". The value 0 indicates the status field value "PENDING". The value 1 indicates the status field value "HEALTHY".
panels.title: CAS state

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "provisioned".

Status field description: The provisioned state of the CAS, i.e., whether the CAS is provisioned.

The value Yes indicates that the CAS is provisioned.

The value No indicates that the CAS is not provisioned.

(Limitation in current implementation: Whether the CAS has been provisioned is currently determined by trying to retrieve a policy called "provisioned" from the CAS. On failure, the CAS is assumed to not have been provisioned. This might not be correct, in the case when the cas was indeed provisioned, but not by using the "kubectl provision cas" command. Using the command "kubectl provision cas" to provision a CAS, always creates a CAS policy called "provisioned".

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated. The value 0 indicates the status field value "No". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Yes".
panels.title: CAS provisioned

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "provisioned".

Status field description: The provisioned state of the CAS, i.e., whether the CAS is provisioned.

The value Yes indicates that the CAS is provisioned.

The value No indicates that the CAS is not provisioned.

(Limitation in current implementation: Whether the CAS has been provisioned is currently determined by trying to retrieve a policy called "provisioned" from the CAS. On failure, the CAS is assumed to not have been provisioned. This might not be correct, in the case when the cas was indeed provisioned, but not by using the "kubectl provision cas" command. Using the command "kubectl provision cas" to provision a CAS, always creates a CAS policy called "provisioned".

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated. The value 0 indicates the status field value "No". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Yes".
panels.title: CAS provisioned

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "phase". Status field description: The phase of the CAS.

The value Deleted indicates that the CAS has been deleted.

The value HEALTHY indicates that the CAS is running without any detected issues.

The value Provisioned indicates that the CAS is provisioned, its state is PENDING.

The value Unprovisioned indicates that the CAS is not provisioned.

The value EnablingMigration indicates that the CAS is provisioned but at least one node has not yet registered a backup CASes as requested.

The value Uninitialized indicates that the CAS is not provisioned and its state is PENDING.

The value AttestationFailure indicates that the CAS is provisioned but the attestation failed.

The value SnapshotFailure indicates the CAS is provisioned but its snapshots are not being performed in requested manner.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates that although the CAS is provisioned, it can be attested and its snapshots are being performed as requested, its state is UNHEALTHY. 

Possible metrics values: -1, a float64 between 0 and 1. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated. Otherwise, the string value of the status field "phase" is mapped to a float64 value between 0 and 1, depending on the string value's index in the ordered list UNHEALTHY, SnapshotFailure, AttestationFailure, EnablingMigration, Uninitialized, Unprovisioned, Provisioned, HEALTHY, Deleted.
panels.title: CAS phase

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "phase". Status field description: The phase of the CAS.

The value Deleted indicates that the CAS has been deleted.

The value HEALTHY indicates that the CAS is running without any detected issues.

The value Provisioned indicates that the CAS is provisioned, its state is PENDING.

The value Unprovisioned indicates that the CAS is not provisioned.

The value EnablingMigration indicates that the CAS is provisioned but at least one node has not yet registered a backup CASes as requested.

The value Uninitialized indicates that the CAS is not provisioned and its state is PENDING.

The value AttestationFailure indicates that the CAS is provisioned but the attestation failed.

The value SnapshotFailure indicates the CAS is provisioned but its snapshots are not being performed in requested manner.

The value UNHEALTHY indicates that although the CAS is provisioned, it can be attested and its snapshots are being performed as requested, its state is UNHEALTHY. 

Possible metrics values: -1, a float64 between 0 and 1. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated. Otherwise, the string value of the status field "phase" is mapped to a float64 value between 0 and 1, depending on the string value's index in the ordered list UNHEALTHY, SnapshotFailure, AttestationFailure, EnablingMigration, Uninitialized, Unprovisioned, Provisioned, HEALTHY, Deleted.
panels.title: CAS phase

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "podDisruptionBudgetAlert".

Status field description: The number of its pods that the CAS is allowing to be shutdown, for example to allow for draining a node.

The value should always be equal to 0. In case it is 1, the pod might be terminated and rescheduled on a different node.

If no nodes exist that have been registered by the CAS' backup-controller, the pod will not come up, until a node where the CAS has been registered joins the cluster.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of its pods that the CAS is allowing to be shut down

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "replicaAlert".

Status field description: The number of expected CAS pods that are not running. (The number of expected CAS pods is always 1.) The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of expected CAS pods that are not running

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "numMigratableNodes".

Status field description: The number of nodes with a successfully registered backup CAS.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of nodes with a registered backup CAS

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "migrationNodeAlert".

Status field description: The number of nodes without a successfully registered backup CAS. The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of nodes without a registered backup CAS

panels.description:
This metric monitors to the status field "migrationControllerReplicaAlert".

Status field description: The number of expected CAS backup-controller pods that are not running. (The number of expected CAS backup-controller pods is always 1.) The value -1 indicates that it could not be calculated.

Possible metrics values: The value of this metric is always equal to the value of the status field.
panels.title: Number of expected CAS backup-controller pods that are not running

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "safetyServiceStatus".

Status field description: The safety service status. It assumes the least healthy state between `safety_service_deployment_status` and `safety_service_pdb_status`

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The value -1 indicates the status field value "Unknown". The value 0 indicates the status field value "Disabled". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Unhealthy". The value 2 indicates the status field value "Alert". The value 3 indicates the status field value "Healthy".
panels.title: Safety Service Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "safetyServiceStatus".

Status field description: The safety service status. It assumes the least healthy state between `safety_service_deployment_status` and `safety_service_pdb_status`

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The value -1 indicates the status field value "Unknown". The value 0 indicates the status field value "Disabled". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Unhealthy". The value 2 indicates the status field value "Alert". The value 3 indicates the status field value "Healthy".
panels.title: Safety Service Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "safetyServiceDeploymentStatus".

Status field description: The status of the safety service deployment.

The value Healthy indicates that current number of ready replicas is equals to the desired number of replicas.

The value Alert indicates that safety service has pending replicas and ready replicas count is less than desired replicas count.

The value Unhealthy indicates that either current ready replicas count is less than spec.safetyService.minReplicas or deployment differs from spec. Also unhealthy if deployment if deployment has unavailable replicas when number of ready replicas count is not less than desired replicas count.

The value Disabled is set when safety service is disabled.

The value Unknown is set when there current status could not be determined.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The value -1 indicates the status field value "Unknown". The value 0 indicates the status field value "Disabled". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Unhealthy". The value 2 indicates the status field value "Alert". The value 3 indicates the status field value "Healthy".
panels.title: Safety Service Deployment Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "safetyServiceDeploymentStatus".

Status field description: The status of the safety service deployment.

The value Healthy indicates that current number of ready replicas is equals to the desired number of replicas.

The value Alert indicates that safety service has pending replicas and ready replicas count is less than desired replicas count.

The value Unhealthy indicates that either current ready replicas count is less than spec.safetyService.minReplicas or deployment differs from spec. Also unhealthy if deployment if deployment has unavailable replicas when number of ready replicas count is not less than desired replicas count.

The value Disabled is set when safety service is disabled.

The value Unknown is set when there current status could not be determined.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The value -1 indicates the status field value "Unknown". The value 0 indicates the status field value "Disabled". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Unhealthy". The value 2 indicates the status field value "Alert". The value 3 indicates the status field value "Healthy".
panels.title: Safety Service Deployment Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "safetyServicePDBStatus".

Status field description: The status of the safety service pod disruption budget.

The value Healthy indicates that pod disruption budget fo the safety service is ok.

The value Alert indicates that pod disruption has no more allowed disruptions.

The value Unhealthy indicates that either the current healthy pods count is less than desired healthy pods count or pdb differs from spec.

The value Disabled is set when safety service is disabled.

The value Unknown is set when there current status could not be determined.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The value -1 indicates the status field value "Unknown". The value 0 indicates the status field value "Disabled". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Unhealthy". The value 2 indicates the status field value "Alert". The value 3 indicates the status field value "Healthy".
panels.title: Safety Service Pod Disruption Budget Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "safetyServicePDBStatus".

Status field description: The status of the safety service pod disruption budget.

The value Healthy indicates that pod disruption budget fo the safety service is ok.

The value Alert indicates that pod disruption has no more allowed disruptions.

The value Unhealthy indicates that either the current healthy pods count is less than desired healthy pods count or pdb differs from spec.

The value Disabled is set when safety service is disabled.

The value Unknown is set when there current status could not be determined.

Possible metrics values: -1, 0, 1, 2, 3. The value -1 indicates the status field value "Unknown". The value 0 indicates the status field value "Disabled". The value 1 indicates the status field value "Unhealthy". The value 2 indicates the status field value "Alert". The value 3 indicates the status field value "Healthy".
panels.title: Safety Service Pod Disruption Budget Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "snapshotStatus".

Status field description: The snapshot status of the CAS.

The value Persisted indicates that snapshots of the CAS DB are successfully being performed and saved on persistent storage as requested (i.e., cas.spec.databaseSnapshots.persistence.enabled == true).

The value Ephemeral indicates that snapshots of the CAS DB are successfully being performed and saved on ephemeral storage as requested (i.e., cas.spec.databaseSnapshots.persistence.enabled == false).

The value Initializing indicates that no snapshot of the CAS DB has been made yet but the requested snapshot interval has not yet expired.

The value Disabled indicates that cas.spec.databaseSnapshots.enabled == false and that no snapshots are being taken of the CAS DB as requested.

The value Failed indicates that the snapshots of the CAS DB are not performed as requested.

Possible metrics values: -1, a float64 between 0 and 1. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated. Otherwise, the string value of the status field "snapshotStatus" is mapped to a float64 value between 0 and 1, depending on the string value's index in the ordered list Failed, Disabled, Initializing, Ephemeral, Persisted.
panels.title: Snapshot Status

panels.description:
This metric corresponds to the status field "snapshotStatus".

Status field description: The snapshot status of the CAS.

The value Persisted indicates that snapshots of the CAS DB are successfully being performed and saved on persistent storage as requested (i.e., cas.spec.databaseSnapshots.persistence.enabled == true).

The value Ephemeral indicates that snapshots of the CAS DB are successfully being performed and saved on ephemeral storage as requested (i.e., cas.spec.databaseSnapshots.persistence.enabled == false).

The value Initializing indicates that no snapshot of the CAS DB has been made yet but the requested snapshot interval has not yet expired.

The value Disabled indicates that cas.spec.databaseSnapshots.enabled == false and that no snapshots are being taken of the CAS DB as requested.

The value Failed indicates that the snapshots of the CAS DB are not performed as requested.

Possible metrics values: -1, a float64 between 0 and 1. The value -1 indicates that the metric could not be calculated. Otherwise, the string value of the status field "snapshotStatus" is mapped to a float64 value between 0 and 1, depending on the string value's index in the ordered list Failed, Disabled, Initializing, Ephemeral, Persisted.
panels.title: Snapshot Status

panels.description:
A binary value indicating whether the snapshots of the CAS database are made as requested.

Possible metrics values: 0, 1. The value 0 indicates success and 1 failure.
panels.title: Snapshot Alert

panels.description:
A binary value indicating whether the snapshots of the CAS database are made as requested.

Possible metrics values: 0, 1. The value 0 indicates success and 1 failure.
panels.title: Snapshot Alert

panels.description:
Timestamp of the most recent snapshot of the CAS DB.

Possible metrics values: -1 or timestamp in seconds. -1 indicates there is no snapshot yet.
panels.title: Most recent CAS DB snapshot timestamp (since 1970)

panels.description:
The time when the snapshot was either last performed or omitted due to lack of change of the CAS DB.

Possible metrics values: -1 or timestamp in seconds. -1 indicates there is no snapshot yet.
panels.title: CAS DB snapshot checked timestamp (since 1970)

panels.description: Current value of snapshot interval configured for CAS (seconds).
panels.title: Snapshot interval configured

options.content:
# SCONE operator controller metrics

This section contains metrics pertaining to the SCONE operator controller, including:

* Certificate read metrics
* Controller runtime metrics
* Go metrics
* Leader election metrics
* Process metrics
* REST client request metrics
* Workqueue metrics

panels.description: Total number of certificate read errors
panels.title: Certificate read errors

panels.description: Total number of certificate reads
panels.title: Total certificate reads

panels.description: Number of currently used workers per controller
panels.title: Controller runtime active workers per controller

panels.description: Total number of reconciliation errors per controller
panels.title: Reconciliation errors per controller

panels.description: Total number of reconciliation panics per controller
panels.title: Reconciliation panics per controller

panels.description: Total number of terminal reconciliation errors per controller
panels.title: Terminal reconciliation errors per controller

panels.description: Total number of reconciliations per controller
panels.title: Reconciliations per controller

panels.description: Maximum number of concurrent reconciles per controller
panels.title: Max concurrent reconciles

panels.description:
Length of time per reconciliation.

99% of reconciliation operations complete within this amount of seconds.
panels.title: Reconcile duration - 99th percentile

panels.description:
Length of time per reconciliation.

50% of reconciliation operations complete within this amount of seconds.
panels.title: Reconcile duration - 50th percentile

panels.description: Total number of webhook panics
panels.title: Webhook panics

panels.description: Current number of admission requests being served.

panels.description: Total number of admission requests by HTTP status code.

panels.description: Information about the Go environment.

panels.description: Total number of goroutines that currently exist.

panels.description: Total number of OS threads created.

panels.description: A summary of the pause duration of garbage collection cycles.
panels.title: Garbage Collection duration

panels.description: Number of bytes allocated and still in use.
panels.title: Allocated bytes in use

panels.description: Total number of bytes allocated, even if freed.
panels.title: Allocated bytes (even if freed)

panels.description: Number of bytes used by the profiling bucket hash table.
panels.title: Profiling bucket hash table bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes used for garbage collection system metadata.
panels.title: Garbage collection metadata bytes in use

panels.description: Number of seconds since 1970 of last garbage collection.

panels.description: Number of heap bytes when next garbage collection will take place.
panels.title: Next garbage collection bytes

panels.description: Total number of frees.
panels.title: Total frees

panels.description: Total number of pointer lookups.

panels.description: Total number of mallocs
panels.title: Mallocs

panels.description: Number of heap bytes released to OS.

panels.description: Number of heap bytes that are in use.

panels.description: Number of heap bytes allocated and still in use.
panels.title: Allocated heap bytes in use

panels.description: Number of heap bytes waiting to be used.
panels.title: Idle heap bytes

panels.description: Number of heap bytes obtained from system.

panels.description: Number of allocated heap objects.
panels.title: Allocated heap objects

panels.description: Number of bytes in use by the stack allocator.
panels.title: Stack bytes in use

panels.description: Number of bytes obtained from system for stack allocator.
panels.title: Stack system bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes in use by mcache structures.
panels.title: mcache structure bytes in use

panels.description: Number of bytes used for mcache structures obtained from system.
panels.title: mcache structure system bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes in use by mspan structures.
panels.title: mspan structure bytes in use

panels.description: Number of bytes used for mspan structures obtained from system.
panels.title: mspan structure system bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes obtained from system.
panels.title: System bytes

panels.description: Number of bytes used for other system allocations.
panels.title: Other system allocation bytes

panels.description: Gauge of if the reporting system is master of the relevant lease, 0 indicates backup, 1 indicates master. 'name' is the string used to identify the lease.
panels.title: Reporting system leader election status

panels.description: Start time of the process since UNIX epoch in seconds.
panels.title: Start time (since 1970)

panels.description: Total user and system CPU time spent in seconds.
panels.title: CPU time spent

panels.description: Number of open file descriptors.
panels.title: Open file descriptors

panels.description: Maximum number of open file descriptors.
panels.title: Maximum file descriptors

panels.description: Virtual memory size in bytes.
panels.title: Virtual memory size

panels.description: Maximum amount of virtual memory available in bytes.
panels.title: Maximum virtual memory size

panels.description: Resident memory size in bytes.
panels.title: Resident memory size

panels.description: Number of HTTP requests, partitioned by status code, method, and host.
panels.title: Number of HTTP requests

panels.description: Total number of adds handled by workqueue
panels.title: Total adds

panels.description: Total number of retries handled by workqueue
panels.title: Total retries

panels.description: Current depth of workqueue
panels.title: Workqueue depth

panels.description:
How many seconds of work has been done that is in progress and hasn't been observed by work_duration. Large values indicate stuck threads.

One can deduce the number of stuck threads by observing the rate at which this increases.
panels.title: Unfinished work duration

panels.description: How many seconds has the longest running processor for workqueue been running.
panels.title: Longest running processor time

panels.description:
How long in seconds an item stays in workqueue before being requested.

99% of items stay up to this amount of time in the workqueue.
panels.title: Queue duration - 99th percentile

panels.description:
How long in seconds an item stays in workqueue before being requested.

50% of items stay up to this amount of time in the workqueue.
panels.title: Queue duration - 50th percentile

panels.description:
How long in seconds processing an item from workqueue takes.

99% of items stay up to this amount of time in process.
panels.title: Processing duration - 99th percentile

panels.description:
How long in seconds processing an item from workqueue takes.

50% of items stay up to this amount of time in process.
panels.title: Processing duration - 50th percentile
